intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium transiens subsp. sintenisii, commonly known as the wandering buttercup, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, dandelion-like flowers. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. It produces a single, showy flower head that blooms in early spring. This subspecies is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through its rhizomes, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
